snippet: A decision by the federal Bureau of Prisons to take 11 months off the sentence of a former El Paso superintendent has angered educators, parents and lawmakers.
abstract: Lorenzo Garcia, former school superintendent in El Paso, Tex, who was sent to prison in one of country's worst education scandals, receives 11-month sentence reduction; decision by Bureau of Prisons has angered educators, parents and lawmakers.
lead_paragraph: A decision by the federal Bureau of Prisons to take 11 months off the sentence of a former El Paso superintendent has angered educators, parents and lawmakers.

headline.main: Sentence Cut in Texas for School Official Jailed in Test Scandal
headline.print_headline: Sentence Cut in Texas For School Official Jailed in Test Scandal
